title: MDBX_MAP_FULL: Environment mapsize limit reached
body:
I have found similar issues here but those are resolved by previous releases.

#### System information

Erigon version: `./erigon --version`

> erigon version 2021.10.3-alpha

OS & Version: Windows/Linux/OSX

> docker, 20.04.1-Ubuntu

#### Expected behaviour

Erigon will run and sync smoothly.

#### Actual behaviour

It fills 2TB on disk and keeps trying to sync, it is writing:

On mainnet 1 node out of 4
```
[INFO] [10-29|07:15:10.785] [4/18 Bodies] Processing bodies...       from=13454019 to=13493233
[EROR] [10-29|07:15:43.848] Staged Sync                              error="[4/18 Bodies] writing block body: failed to WriteRawTransactions: bucket: BlockTransaction, mdbx_cursor_put: MDBX_MAP_FULL: Environment mapsize limit reached"
[INFO] [10-29|07:15:44.380] [4/18 Bodies] Processing bodies...       from=13454019 to=13493233
[EROR] [10-29|07:16:17.599] Staged Sync                              error="[4/18 Bodies] writing block body: failed to WriteRawTransactions: bucket: BlockTransaction, mdbx_cursor_put: MDBX_MAP_FULL: Environment mapsize limit reached"
```

We have also seen this behavior on 2 nodes out of 4 on rinkeby (on different blocks). The other nodes has ~275GB of data, but the problematic one growth to 2TB and stopped syncing.

#### Steps to reproduce the behaviour

Don't know, some nodes are running ok, some are not.
`du -h datadir` please
Do you do any long reads from database (or by RPC)?

```
# du -h ./
2.0T	./chaindata
73M	./nodes/eth65
65M	./nodes/eth66
137M	./nodes
3.0K	./erigon
2.0T	./
```
I am not exactly sure about "long running db reads", but on 2 of those dead nodes we are calling debug_traceTransaction or debug_traceBlock which is taking like ~1 minute. But on one crashed node we are not doing that - so I guess it is not root cause.

1 minute - is fine.

You can try:
```
make db-tools
mv <datadir>/chaindata  <datadir>/chaindata_backup
./build/bin/mdbx_copy -c <datadir>/chaindata_backup <datadir>/chaindata
# then chaindata folder must get small
```

we are using docker image based on `thorax/erigon:v2021.10.03` which probably doesn't contain `mdbx_copy` executable
```
$ ls -al /usr/local/bin/
...
-rwxr-xr-x    1 root     root      53369184 Oct 14 12:09 erigon
-rwxr-xr-x    1 root     root      51893688 Oct 14 12:09 integration
-rwxr-xr-x    1 root     root      33848832 Oct 14 12:09 rpcdaemon
-rwxr-xr-x    1 root     root      32667088 Oct 14 12:10 sentry
```

I guess it might be the `integration`

```
$ integration --help
long and heavy integration tests for Erigon

Usage:
  integration [command]

Available Commands:
  ...
  f_to_mdbx         copy data from '--chaindata' to '--chaindata.to'
  ...
  mdbx_to_mdbx      copy data from '--chaindata' to '--chaindata.to'
  ...
```

Unfortunately, we already had to destroy the environments (and start them from snapshot), but I guess this might be a workaround if it will happen next time.

> which probably doesn't contain `mdbx_copy` executable

`mdbx_copy` executable is obtained by `make db-tools` (db tools are not built by default)

This is on latest master, on an HDD RAID10 stripe of 5 mirrors. I was able to sync mainnet on this setup and it synced fully and was keeping up for days before it got stuck in this state.

I accidentally synced with pruning off originally, then added `--prune htc`; that seemed to work out fine, but the size of `chaindata` didn't decrease.
"I accidentally synced with pruning off originally, then added --prune htc" - Erigon must not allow this. If it does - it's bug.
here is the fix to prohibit change prune mode: https://github.com/ledgerwatch/erigon/pull/2907
I see. I guess I will just sync from scratch then. Thanks for the quick fix to prevent anyone else getting stuck like this :)

We got some output of `mdbx_stat -a` which showed us that something is wrong with "EthTransactions" table: 
https://gist.github.com/LefterisJP/1c9ef4ecb451e1f4c9f93b6e6a3681aa#file-mdbx_stat-log-L45
likely we have bug as BodiesDownload stage, we will investigate.
FWIW, I also ran into this on a mainnet archive node and as the docker container doesn't include that mdbx_copy tool, all I could do is to re-sync from scratch.
In this case copy will not help. Only https://github.com/ledgerwatch/erigon/pull/2941 can help, but itâ€™s not released yet.

Hi. I created for you branch `mdbx_revert_augument_limit_stable`.
It's `stable` (beta) + 2 fixes about db size growth: https://github.com/ledgerwatch/erigon/pull/2949
https://github.com/ledgerwatch/erigon/pull/2956
But likely you nee re-sync.

Hi @KaiRo-at , did you confirm the `v2021.11.03` tag solved the issue? I have the same `MDBX_MAP_FULL: Environment mapsize limit reached` issue with the `v2021.11.02` tag when the archive node was fully re-synced and looking for a solution. Thanks.
I can't say if it's fixed forever, but after a re-sync with `v2021.11.03` I did not run into the problem again so far.
